Package calculator

Class CalculatorAdvanced

java.lang.Object
calculator.Calculator
calculator.CalculatorAdvanced
public class CalculatorAdvanced
extends Calculator
The CalculatorAdvanced class implements an application that calculates advanced operations: factorial of a number '!' and exponential value of a number. It also checks if number is Armstrong or Perfect number.
Since:
2020-12-24
Version:
1.0
Author:
Tatjana Tomic

  • Method Details

    • calculateAdvanced

      public void calculateAdvanced​(char action) throws NumberNotInAreaException, NotSupportedOperationException
      The method calculates advanced mathematical operations: factorial of a number and exponential value of a number. The operand of operation is integer value od ottribute currentValue.
      Parameters:
      action - If passed parameter is '!', it calculates factorial. If passed parameter is number in range [0, 9], it calculates exponential value. Passed value is exponent.
      Throws:
      NumberNotInAreaException - Method throws NumberNotInAreaException if the currentValue is out of the assigned range.
      NotSupportedOperationException - Method throws NotSupportedOperationException if passed value is not equal to some of implemented operations.
      See Also:
      NumberNotInAreaException, NotSupportedOperationException

    • hasCharacteristic

      public java.lang.Boolean hasCharacteristic​(char value) throws NumberNotInAreaException, NotSupportedOperationException
      Method calculates if the currentValue is Armstrong or perfect number.
      Parameters:
      value - In case of 'A', the method checks if currentValue is Armstrong number. In case of 'P', the method checks if currentValue is Perfect number.
      Returns:
      True if currentValue is Armstrong/Perfect.
      Throws:
      NumberNotInAreaException - Method throws NumberNotInAreaException if the currentValue is less than 1.
      NotSupportedOperationException - Method throws NotSupportedOperationException if passed value is not equal to 'A' or 'P'.
      See Also:
      NumberNotInAreaException, NotSupportedOperationException
